definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: It was tabloid size and had only eight pages, which were badly printed.
sentences.chinese: 那是一份小開報紙，只有八頁，印刷得很粗糙。

definition: high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
roll call/to mention sb by name/(to call or praise or criticize sb) by name
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
to talk from one's personal experience/to use oneself as an example
a mom (mother of a young child)
handed down in a family/family traditions
to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
the only son of a family/(functional programming or philosophy) monad
